abilitygroupdescription.p: The ability to use a language. In the normal course of events if a character knows a language then they do not have to check to communicate using that language. If a character knows a language then the only time they need to check is in difficult circumstances, the character is rushing, the language is complex, there is a lot of background noise, the writing is on damaged parchment, .
Language ability ranks all perform the same way, as follows:

descriptions.description: The character can speak the language a little. They know some words and can maybe make their meaning clear. Test for success for every complicated interaction or interaction under .
The character has the ability to speak the language fairly fluently. Only check under difficult circumstances (background noise).
The character has the ability to read and write some text written in the language. Check every time the character tries to read or write this language.
The character has the ability to read and write some text written in the language. Only check under difficult circumstances.
The character is fluent in the language. They can read and write the language and perform research in books written in the given language. Only check in the most difficult of circumstances.

abilitydescription.p: Alemagne is spoken by the natives of Almaignia, north of Fafnir's Tusks and to the east of Westreich. It is a backwoods dialect of Merovingian spoken by peasants and farmers.

Aquilonian is spoken in the by members of the now-fallen Aquilonian Empire. It is the language of scholarship and used amongst the learned. Aquillonian is related to Occitan and Leonese. If you have Aquilonian then you can undestand and speak Occitan and Leonese at two ranks lower than your Aquilonian rank.
Fey is the native language of the Fey and other denizens of the Wyld, the High Elves and the Dark Elves.
Lagashi is the language of the east. It is spoken in Ophyr, Arkadia, Vendryha and the Bandit Kingdoms.

The language spoken in the Border Principalities and the Wild Coast. It is related to Aquillonian. If you have Leonese then you can undestand and speak Aquillonian at two ranks lower than your Leonese rank.

This ability represents the characters ability to speak, read or write Merovingian, the language of Westreich the language of the Empire in the West, the language of most of Averoigne, and of Albion, and a langauge which is in common use in the civilized world and used as a language of trade.
This ability represents the characters ability to speak, read or write Poitevin, the language of south east Averoigne.
Occitan is spoken in southern Averoigne and Castria. It is related to Aquillonian. If you have Occitan then you can undestand and speak Aquillonian at two ranks lower than your Occitan rank.
The ability to speak Hybernian. The language of the Northern Barbarians.

Spoken by the creatures from beyond this plane and the ancients, Inochian is a dead language now used only for magic. It is composed of syllables that when intoned resonate with the planes and form contagious conduits through which magic may flow. Inochian is the language of magic.
Sylvan is the language of the Wood Elves. It is bastardized form of the Fey language. That has changed so much over time that it is now a distinct language
The ability to speak Thule. The language of the North Eastern lands.
